member.name: T:Pdia.Web.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator
member.summary: This class will create an object of a given type and populate it with sample data.

member.name: M:Pdia.Web.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: T:Pdia.Web.Helpers.TokenManager.JsonWebToken
member.summary: Provides methods for encoding and decoding JSON Web Tokens.

member.name: M:Pdia.Web.Helpers.TokenManager.JsonWebToken.Encode(System.Object,System.String,Pdia.Web.Helpers.TokenManager.JwtHashAlgorithm)
member.summary: Creates a JWT given a payload, the signing key, and the algorithm to use.
member.param: An arbitrary payload (must be serializable to JSON via ).
The key used to sign the token.

member.name: M:Pdia.Web.Helpers.TokenManager.JsonWebToken.Decode(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Given a JWT, decode it and return the JSON payload.
member.param: The key that was used to sign the JWT.
Whether to verify the signature (default is true).
member.returns: A string containing the JSON payload.
member.exception: Thrown if the verify parameter was true and the signature was NOT valid or if the JWT was signed with an unsupported algorithm.

member.name: M:Pdia.Web.Helpers.TokenManager.JsonWebToken.Decode``1(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Given a JWT, decode it and return the payload as an object (by deserializing it with ).
member.param: The key that was used to sign the JWT.
Whether to verify the signature (default is true).
member.exception: Thrown if the verify parameter was true and the signature was NOT valid or if the JWT was signed with an unsupported algorithm.
